citation.article-title: Paenibacillus xinjiangensis sp. nov., isolated from Xinjiang province in China
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus xinjiangensis sp. nov.
Paenibacillus xinjiangensis (xin.ji.ang.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. xinjiangensis pertaining to Xinjiang in China, where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are approximately 0.8–1.2 μm wide and 2.0–3.2 μm long.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Colonies are smooth, circular to slightly irregular, slightly convex and cream coloured on TSB agar.
Growth occurs at 10–40 °C (optimum, 30–35 °C), 0–3 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 0–1 %) and pH 6.5–9.8 (optimum, pH 8.0–8.5).
Does not hydrolyse casein, starch, Tweens 20 or 80, l-tyrosine, hypoxanthine, xanthine or urea.

Acids are produced from d-glucose, lactose, glycerol, l-rhamnose, d-xylose, sucrose, d-melibiose, d-trehalose, maltose, d-raffinose, d-ribose, d-mannose, l-arabinose and d-fructose, but not from d-mannitol, adonitol or salicin.
Cell wall contains meso-diaminopimelic acid (A1γ type).
The major cellular fatty acids on TSB agar are anteiso-C15 : 0 (48.61 %), C16 : 0 (14.43 %), iso-C16 : 0 (9.65 %) and iso-C15 : 0 (9.32 %).
The type strain is B538T (=KCTC 3952T=DSM 16970T), isolated from Xinjiang province in China.
